column1: These types of birth control pills are used for women who have medical reasons that prevent them from taking a combination oral contraceptive pill (pills that contain progestin and estrogen).
Tell your provider or pharmacist if you take any other medicines, such as antibiotics, seizure medicine, medicine to treat HIV, or St.

Call your health care provider if: - You have swelling in your leg - You have leg pain - Your leg feels warm to the touch or has changes in skin color - You have fever or chills - You are short of breath and it is hard to breathe - You have chest pain - You cough up blood
